text: It’s Cool to Be Safe
label: TITLE

text: Printed on Recycled Paper
label: BODY

text: Forest Service FY 2010 Guidance for Use of Incident Job Codes
label: BODY

text: Attachment A – August, 2009
label: BODY

text: The following direction and procedures will be used to establish and charge to wildland fire,
label: BODY

text: severity and support job codes in FY 2010:
label: BODY

text: Incident job codes will have the region/unit override of the incident host unit.  Incidents that
label: BODY

text: qualify for a unique incident job code are as follows and will be established in the FireCode
label: BODY

text: system:
label: BODY

text:  Wildfire incidents 300 acres or more
label: BODY

text:  Type 1 or Type 2 IMT is ordered
label: BODY

text:  Type 3 organization is used
label: BODY

text: P codes will be established only for direct suppression expenditures through the FireCode
label: BODY

text: system.   Base salary will be charged to wildland fire suppression (WFSU) for all employees
label: BODY

text: assigned to fire incidents.
label: BODY

text: Each land based unit will have one code for ABCD fires.   These codes will be the same as in
label: BODY

text: 2009, and will be reestablished by ASC for 2010. (see spreadsheet at
label: BODY

text: http://www.fs.fed.us/fire/ibp/cost_accounting/cost_accounting.html ) All ABCD codes will be
label: BODY

text: used with the region/unit override.  The ABCD code format will be P#XXXX (where # is the
label: BODY

text: region number and XXXX is created by the FireCode system).  The ABCD codes will be used
label: BODY

text: for the following:
label: BODY

text:  Initial response to wildfires.
label: BODY

text:  False alarms (including FS response to DOI false alarms)
label: BODY

text:  Extended response to wildfires under 300 acres (except as noted above)
label: BODY

text: Each land based unit will have one code for fire support.  These codes will be used for salary and
label: BODY

text: other project support charges by dispatch centers, local caches, and unit employees providing
label: BODY

text: general fire support that have traditionally been charged to ABCD Misc.  Support codes will be
label: BODY

text: used when an employee is working on multiple fires with different P codes and time cannot
label: BODY

text: reasonably be separated out.  If personnel are working on actual support to ongoing ABCD fires,
label: BODY

text: they should charge to the ABCD code.  These codes will be the same as 2009 and will be
label: BODY

text: reestablished by ASC for 2010.
label: BODY

text: P-codes generated from the National Interagency Coordination Center (NICC) will use “W” as
label: BODY

text: the second digit in the code.
label: BODY

text: The following non-land based units will have a support code for all salary charges:   The ASC,
label: BODY

text: National Caches, GACCs, NICC, NIFC, ROs and the WO. When converting from WFPR work
label: BODY

text: to WFSU fire support, salary charges will be made to this support code.  Employees at these
label: BODY

text: Regional Foresters, Station Directors, Area Director, ITTF Director, Deputy Chiefs and WO
label: BODY

text: Directors
label: BODY

text: units will charge to a P or F code when they are specifically assigned to an incident or supporting
label: BODY

text: only one incident and can identify time in minimum four hours blocks.  WFSU fire support
label: BODY

text: codes for non-land based units will change in 2010 from a “WFSU” code to a pre-established
label: BODY

text: code generated from Firecode with a WG prefix (WG#### where # is the generated Firecode).
label: BODY

text: Each Region will have one P code for staging and/or transporting unassigned resources.  The
label: BODY

text: code of the requesting Region will be used on resource orders. Use of this code will be short
label: BODY

text: term in nature and be limited to times when resources are being ordered for active fire incidents,
label: BODY

text: but the location of the resource assignment is not known. These codes will be pre-established and
label: BODY

text: will use the region/unit override in the following format: P#XXXX, where the XXXX is created
label: BODY

text: by the FireCode system.
label: BODY

text: Units are asked to limit the number of additional codes created in the FireCode system.  While it
label: BODY

text: is understood there are situations where the established codes are not adequate for specific needs,
label: BODY

text: units should adequately describe the purpose of the code in the FireCode name field.
label: BODY

text: The following information is provided to update the appropriate use of incident and severity
label: BODY

text: codes for the FY 2010 season.
label: BODY

text: P-codes:
label: BODY

text: Costs for responses for all size class A, B, C, and D wildfires for each forest will
label: BODY

text: be collected under one P-code per Forest, except as noted below.  Format is
label: BODY

text: P#XXXX (where # is region and XXXX is created by the FireCode system),
label: BODY

text: region/unit override will be used.  Established codes will be posted to the Forest
label: BODY

text: Service Incident Business website:
label: BODY

text: http://www.fs.fed.us/fire/ibp/cost_accounting/cost_accounting.html.
label: BODY

text: Do not issue a unique P-code for wildfires under 300 acres unless you are certain
label: BODY

text: it meets at least one of the following criteria:
label: BODY

text:  Human caused
label: BODY

text:  Trespass
label: BODY

text:  Expected reimbursement
label: BODY

text:  Cost share
label: BODY

text:  Type 1, 2, or 3 Incident Management Team assigned
label: BODY

text: Charge to the ABCD code until such time as you have determined one of the
label: BODY

text: above criteria exists.  All wildfires that are size class E, F, or G will be issued a
label: BODY

text: unique P-code with the region/unit override.
label: BODY

text: P-codes for
label: BODY

text: DOI Fires:
label: BODY

text: All Department of Interior (DOI) fire codes will be issued by dispatch personnel
label: BODY

text: or a DOI representative through the FireCode system.  Fire codes will pass to the
label: BODY

text: FS Financial system only if the fire code is flagged in the FireCode system with
label: BODY

text: a value of “Y” for FS Assist. FS Assist should not be checked unless there is
label: BODY

text: certainty that there will be Forest Service resources responding. These codes
label: BODY

text: allow FS resources to charge to a FireCode in support of DOI fires and will be
label: BODY

text: assigned the appropriate letter (D=BLM, A=BIA, P=NPS, R=FWS) after the P.
label: BODY

text: An override of 1502 will be used for all DOI fires.
label: BODY

text: Regional Foresters, Station Directors, Area Director, ITTF Director, Deputy Chiefs and WO
label: BODY

text: Directors
label: BODY

text: H-codes:
label: BODY

text: Use H-codes for approved BAER projects.  One H-code will be established for
label: BODY

text: each Region to track assessment expenditures for BAER teams.  The H-codes will
label: BODY

text: be established in the format:  H#BAER (where # is the Region number).  A
label: BODY

text: Regional override will be used.
label: BODY

text: These unique codes will enhance the ability of each Region to monitor annual
label: BODY

text: assessment costs and simplify the process of establishing codes in time-critical
label: BODY

text: situations.  It also provides for the transaction code (in accordance with Public
label: BODY

text: Law 106-558) to be used for overtime rate equal to one and one-half times the
label: BODY

text: hourly rate, which is appropriate for individuals involved in the preparation of a
label: BODY

text: BAER plan.  The overtime provisions apply only until the initial BAER plan is
label: BODY

text: submitted for approval.  (See FSM 2523.)
label: BODY

text: Each unit is responsible for contacting the ASC Incident Finance at
label: BODY

text: asc_ipc@fs.fed.us  to request H-codes for BAER plan implementation, once the
label: BODY

text: plan is approved.  The H-code should mirror the P-code, including the region/unit
label: BODY

text: override.  If the P-code was a non FS jurisdictional incident and reflected a
label: BODY

text: region/unit override of 1502, the H-code will reflect the region/unit override of
label: BODY

text: the requesting unit.
label: BODY

text: AD Support: A WFSUAD code for AD (Casual) training and Work Capacity Test will be
label: BODY

text: issued for each Region.  These codes are to be used for allowable expenditures for
label: BODY

text: suppression funds.  A Regional override will be used.
label: BODY

text: Exclusive Use
label: BODY

text: Aviation
label: BODY

text: Contracts:
label: BODY

text: Each region will be assigned a code for Exclusive Use contract availability as
label: BODY

text: designated in the FY 2010 Program Direction.  These codes will be pre-
label: BODY

text: established code generated from Firecode with a WA prefix (WA#### where # is
label: BODY

text: the generated Firecode) with Region/Unit override.
label: BODY

text: National aviation contracts will also be assigned a unique code for availability
label: BODY

text: payments.
label: BODY

text: S-codes:
label: BODY

text: Each Forest will have two S-codes for severity.  One code for Washington Office
label: BODY

text: approved severity and a second code for Regional Office approved severity.
label: BODY

text: National severity codes will be established in the format: S#9999 and the
label: BODY

text: Regional codes in the format: S#1111.  Region/Unit overrides will be used.
label: BODY

text: Please note that OMB is closely monitoring FS use of severity and funding levels
label: BODY

text: are being controlled through the apportionment process.  Regions should insure
label: BODY

text: that severity funds have been approved prior to charging to severity job codes.
label: BODY

text: Regional Foresters, Station Directors, Area Director, ITTF Director, Deputy Chiefs and WO
label: BODY

text: Directors
label: BODY

text: S-codes for
label: BODY

text: DOI Severity: Assistance to Department of the Interior severity authorizations will be tracked
label: BODY

text: separately.  S-codes will be established to be used by individuals assisting a DOI
label: BODY

text: Bureau under a severity request.  Use the following S-codes on all related
label: BODY

text: timesheets and travel vouchers.  Do not use the individual severity codes
label: BODY

text: established by DOI in the FireCode system as they will not be compatible with
label: BODY

text: our systems.
label: BODY

text: Job Code
label: BODY

text: Override
label: BODY

text: Agency
label: BODY

text: Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) –
label: BODY

text: Severity assistance.
label: BODY

text: Bureau of Land Management
label: BODY

text: (BLM) – Severity assistance.
label: BODY

text: Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS)
label: BODY

text: – Severity assistance.
label: BODY

text: National Park Service (NPS) –
label: BODY

text: Severity assistance.
label: BODY

text: FS Support of
label: BODY

text: Non-Federal
label: BODY

text: Fires:
label: BODY

text: States will not be utilizing the FireCode system to establish codes for non-federal
label: BODY

text: fires.  When federal resources respond and provide support to non-federal fires,
label: BODY

text: the FS or DOI will create a fire code.  The agency that receives the request
label: BODY

text: initially, and fills an order, is responsible for generating the fire code.  These
label: BODY

text: codes will be established with PN as the first two characters and the remaining
label: BODY

text: four characters/digits will be generated by the FireCode system.  These codes will
label: BODY

text: have an override of 1502.
label: BODY

text: Non-Wildland Federal
label: BODY

text: Fire Departments/
label: BODY

text: Agencies:
label: BODY

text: Non-wildland Federal fire departments and agencies, including but not limited to
label: BODY

text: DOD and Tennessee Valley Authority, will not be utilizing the FireCode system
label: BODY

text: to establish codes for their federal fires.  When federal resources respond and
label: BODY

text: provide support to Federal non-wildland fire departments or agencies, the FS or
label: BODY

text: DOI will retrieve a fire code.  The agency that receives the request initially, and
label: BODY

text: fills an order, is responsible for generating the fire code.  These codes will be
label: BODY

text: established with PF as the first two characters and the remaining four
label: BODY

text: characters/digits will be generated by the FireCode system.  Use override 1502.
label: BODY

text: F-codes for
label: BODY

text: FEMA Activations:
label: BODY

text: Non-Fire FEMA Incident: A unique F-code will be established for each Mission
label: BODY

text: Assignment received from FEMA for ESF4 non-fire activation. ASC-IF will not
label: BODY

text: pre-establish these codes in FFIS, however a protocol has been provided in the
label: BODY

text: attached spreadsheet for use on non-fire FEMA responses.  FEMA codes will use
label: BODY

text: Regional Foresters, Station Directors, Area Director, ITTF Director, Deputy Chiefs and WO
label: BODY

text: Directors
label: BODY

text: the region/unit override in the following format:  F#0000 where # is the Region in
label: BODY

text: which the response is taking place.  ASC-Incident Finance shall be notified by the
label: BODY

text: Region or National Office, as soon as a job code has been assigned so that it can
label: BODY

text: be established for use in FFIS.  ASC-IF must also be provided a copy of the
label: BODY

text: Mission Assignment (MA).
label: BODY

text: Fire ESF4 Incident: Utilize FireCode for ESF4 wildland fire activations.  ESF4
label: BODY

text: Fire Mission Assignments are the only MAs where multiple job codes can be
label: BODY

text: assigned. The majority of FEMA ESF4 fires will start out with a PN**** or
label: BODY

text: P#**** Firecode. When the fire is assigned to ESF4, the P code will change to a
label: BODY

text: F#**** where # is the Region number, and **** is the same Firecode as the P
label: BODY

text: code. For example PNLMNO would change to F#LMNO. In situations where the
label: BODY

text: fire did not start out as a state PN code, assign a Firecode with a prefix of F#.
label: BODY

text: This will provide consistency with the current job code process for wildfire and
label: BODY

text: will maintain the integrity of the fire costs for the specific fire.  Each fire covered
label: BODY

text: by the MA will have a unique F code.  ASC-IF will be notified, as soon as a job
label: BODY

text: code has been assigned or converted from a P# so that it can be established for use
label: BODY

text: in FFIS.  ASC-IF must also be provided a copy of the Mission Assignment.
label: BODY

text: Base salary of all employees on assignment to a declared emergency will be paid
label: BODY

text: from the Emergency Operations (WFSU) account.
label: BODY

text: Non-Fire
label: BODY

text: Emergency
label: BODY

text: Job Codes:
label: BODY

text: Upon execution of an interagency reimbursable agreement the Unit should request
label: BODY

text: a unique reimbursable job code with the appropriate reimbursable program and
label: BODY

text: fund.  Contact ASC-Incident Finance to create the code prior to incurring any
label: BODY

text: expenses.  Do not create a fire code in the FireCode system for non fire
label: BODY

text: emergencies.
label: BODY

text: Fire codes are processed into FFIS as they are created in the FireCode system.  The job code
label: BODY

text: cycles in FFIS do not run on Friday and Saturday night.  Therefore, incident job codes passed to
label: BODY

text: FFIS on Friday and Saturday nights will not be available for use (in Paycheck and other systems)
label: BODY

text: until after processing on Sunday night.
label: BODY

text: For Fire Code questions, contact Marylea Lockard, ASC Incident Finance at 505-563-7411;  Fire
label: BODY

text: and Aviation funding policy questions, Branch Chief, Fire Planning 202-205-0996;
label: BODY

text: implementation questions MaryAnn Szymoniak at 208-387-5944.
label: BODY
